boat.construction_details: Carvel pitch pine on steamed oak, copper fastened

for_sales.sales_text: Freda was designed by the Itchen Ferry maestro Dan Hatcher, using almost identical lines to his masterpiece Wonder. She was built in 1890 by Fay of Northam. It is believed that not only is she probably the most original Itchen Ferry working boat in existence but possibly the fastest on handicap as well. Hardly suprising when we discover her owner was Captain Sam Randall, a famous big boat racing skipper of the day. Details: Construction- Pitch pine on oak Dimensions- Length 18-6 Waterline 18' Draft 3'-4" Footprint33" Electrical two batteries, isolation switch New electric bilge pump Engine-Yanmar IG10 Spars- Columbian pine mast,boom, bowsprit Sails- main, jib, foresail, topsail, genoa Wykeham Martin furling gear Raytheon depth sounder Anchor and various warps fenders etc Cockpit cover Manual Patay bilge pumpLying Woodbridge Suffolk

boat.full_description: 'Freda' is an original Dan Hatcher by Fay of Northam, launched in 1890 She was raced by Captain Sam Randall and served as a working boat all her life with fishing no. CS110. Fully restored in the 1990s, she continues to be a race and Concours winner.
boat.name: Freda
boat.short_description: The Itchen Ferry 'Freda' has lines identical to 'Wonder', but she's 6" shorter according to a survey in 1996.
